2022-11-25.name: Free Entrance Day at Minnesota state parks
2022-11-25.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2022-11-25.name: Holiday Homecoming & Electric Parade
2022-11-25.summary: There will be a kickoff to the Holiday Tree Trail, a window-decorating contest and the Electric Christmas Parade.

2022-11-25.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2022-11-25.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-11-25.name: Holly Days
2022-11-25.summary: This Door County village offers horse-drawn wagon rides, a children's elf hunt and mistle dough contest and caroling.

2022-11-25.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-11-25.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-11-25.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2022-11-25.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-11-25.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-11-25.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2022-11-25.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2022-11-25.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2022-11-25.name: ZooLights
2022-11-25.summary: Admission to the annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays. Reserve time slots in advance.

2022-11-25.name: Festive Friday Eves
2022-11-25.summary: Christmas celebrations, each with a different theme, are held at Cedar Creek Settlement,  a restored 1864 woolen mill in this historic village just north of Milwaukee. Each features live holiday music, crafts, luminaries, wine-tasting and cookies and cider.

2022-11-25.name: Holiday Kerstmarkt
2022-11-25.summary: This open-air European Christmas Market at the Eighth Street Market  Place includes 18 timber booths offering Dutch imports, folk art,  hand-knit apparel and other gifts.

2022-11-25.name: Rotary Lights
2022-11-25.summary: In Riverside Park, see a holiday display of 3 million lights with music. It opens with a parade, and Santa and reindeer are there every night through Dec. 23, with a live Nativity some nights. There are also carriage and helicopter rides, an ice rink with free use of skates, and free s'mores at fire pits.

2022-11-25.name: Christkindlsmarkt
2022-11-25.summary: The open-air market in this Minneapolis suburb on Lake Minnetonka opens with a parade and includes concerts, balloon art, storytelling, reindeer, visits with the Christkind, mugs of warm Glühwein and a children's lantern parade at 4 p.m. Saturday.

2022-11-25.name: European Christmas Market
2022-11-25.summary: This Christkindlmarkt in Union Depot features choirs, dancers, hot mulled wine, holiday beers,  European-inspired food and artisan goods.

2022-11-25.name: German Christmas Market
2022-11-25.summary: This downtown market features vendors in outdoor huts as well as heated tents  for music, German food, gingerbread-decorating and a beer garden.

2022-11-25.name: Chris Kringle Market
2022-11-25.summary: This town on the Illinois River kicks off its downtown festival with a parade, followed by fireworks.

2022-11-25.name: Door County Christkindlmarkt
2022-11-25.summary: This market on the grounds of the Corner of the Past Museum, a recreated pioneer homestead south of town, features local vendors and artisans, live music, and German dishes served inside a large barn.

2022-11-25.name: Holiday Stroll
2022-11-25.summary: This Mississippi River town offers a window-display scavenger hunt, lighted parade, medallion hunt, wagon rides, a Holiday Village and Santa, plus Star Wars characters.

2022-11-25.name: Festival of Lights Parade
2022-11-25.summary: In this northwest suburb of Chicago, the holiday parade starts at 7 p.m.

2022-11-25.name: Parade of Lights
2022-11-25.summary: The holiday parade downtown will be from 6 to 7 p.m.

2022-11-25.name: Holidazzle
2022-11-25.summary: This free holiday market in Loring Park, on the edge of downtown, features an artisan market, appearances by Santa and the illuminated Holidazzle Yeti, outdoor yoga, choirs, a beer garden and fireworks.

2022-11-18.name: Christmas by the Bay
2022-11-18.summary: There's a car parade Friday evening, followed by tree light, caroling and horse-drawn wagon rides. On Saturday, there's a parade at 10 a.m.

2022-11-18.name: Winterer's Gathering
2022-11-18.summary: There's a tent encampment, winter skills seminars, Arctic film festival and chili feed at the North House Folk School.

2022-11-18.name: Outdoor Adventure Expo
2022-11-18.summary: The expo at the Midwest Mountaineering store on the West Bank includes dozens of speakers and seminars about skiing, sled-dog racing and ice-climbing as well as camping, backpacking and other year-round adventures.

2022-11-18.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-11-18.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-11-18.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2022-11-18.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-11-18.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-11-18.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2022-11-18.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2022-11-18.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2022-11-18.name: Festive Friday Eves
2022-11-18.summary: Christmas celebrations, each with a different theme, are held at Cedar Creek Settlement,  a restored 1864 woolen mill in this historic village just north of Milwaukee. Each features live holiday music, crafts, luminaries, wine-tasting and cookies and cider.

2022-11-18.name: Holiday Folk Fair International
2022-11-18.summary: More than 50 ethnic groups present music, dance, food and crafts from around the world at the Wisconsin State Fair Exposition Center.

2022-11-18.name: Christkindlmarkt
2022-11-18.summary: This Lake Michigan town holds its Old World Christmas market in Lakehaven Hall, with a craft market, music and German food. On Friday, there's a holiday lights parade at 6:30 p.m.

2022-11-19.name: Christmas by the Bay
2022-11-19.summary: There's a car parade Friday evening, followed by tree light, caroling and horse-drawn wagon rides. On Saturday, there's a parade at 10 a.m.

2022-11-19.name: Magnificent Mile Lights Festival & Parade
2022-11-19.summary: There will be music and family activities on Michigan Avenue, with a  lighted parade from Oak Street to Wacker Drive, followed by fireworks over the Chicago River.

2022-11-19.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-11-19.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-11-19.name: Pangea
2022-11-19.summary: Celebrate global cultures at the Hjemkomst Center, with folk dancing, storytelling, music and foods from seven countries. Children can pick up a passport to get stamped at booths.

2022-11-19.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-11-19.summary: This open-air European Christmas Market at the Eighth Street Market  Place includes 18 timber booths offering Dutch imports, folk art,  hand-knit apparel and other gifts.

2022-11-19.name: Christmas Light Parade
2022-11-19.summary: The 6 p.m. parade includes live reindeer, horses, marching bands and floats. See Santa at the Al Ringling Theatre afterward for photos and treats.

2022-11-19.name: Holiday Parade
2022-11-19.summary: The parade starts at 10 a.m. downtown, at Jefferson and Stuart streets, and includes marching bands, hot-air balloons and Santa with reindeer.

2022-11-20.summary: There's a car parade Friday evening, followed by tree light, caroling and horse-drawn wagon rides. On Saturday, there's a parade at 10 a.m.

2022-11-11.name: Gales of November
2022-11-11.summary: Listen to experts discuss Lake Superior shipwrecks and maritime history. There are social events, too, open to the public.

2022-11-12.name: Gales of November
2022-11-12.summary: Listen to experts discuss Lake Superior shipwrecks and maritime history. There are social events, too, open to the public.

2022-11-12.name: Trainfest
2022-11-12.summary: The nation's largest operating model railroad show includes more than 60 scenic railroads, clinics for hobbyists and many children's activities.

2022-11-12.name: Art on the Prairie
2022-11-12.summary: This free festival northwest of Des Moines showcases more than 100 Iowa artists, poets and musicians in seven venues, including the Hotel Pattee, in the downtown historic and cultural district. There will also be children's activities.

2022-11-12.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-11-12.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-11-12.name: Winter Art Fair Off the Square
2022-11-12.summary: Art Fair Off the Square presents its winter edition in Monona Terrace, with 140 fine artists from around Wisconsin.

2022-11-04.summary: In the northeast arts district, 350 artists open their studios and offer demonstrations and workshops.

2022-11-04.name: Driftless Film Festival
2022-11-04.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2022-11-05.name: Art Attack
2022-11-05.summary: In the northeast arts district, 350 artists open their studios and offer demonstrations and workshops.

2022-11-05.name: Veterans Day Parade
2022-11-05.summary: It's at 11 a.m., starting on Wisconsin Avenue, crossing the river and heading north on Water Street. After the parade, there's a festival at the Marcus Center, with music, entertainment and a veteran-owned market.

2022-11-05.name: Driftless Film Festival
2022-11-05.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2022-11-10.name: Beacon lighting at Split Rock Lighthouse
2022-11-10.summary: This event, which commemorates the 1975 sinking of the ore freighter with 29 men, is the only time the             public can see the interior of the light tower when the beacon is lighted.

2022-11-27.summary: This downtown market features vendors in outdoor huts as well as heated tents  for music, German food, gingerbread-decorating and a beer garden.

2022-11-27.name: Chris Kringle Market
2022-11-27.summary: This town on the Illinois River kicks off its downtown festival with a parade, followed by fireworks.

2022-11-27.name: Door County Christkindlmarkt
2022-11-27.summary: This market on the grounds of the Corner of the Past Museum, a recreated pioneer homestead south of town, features local vendors and artisans, live music, and German dishes served inside a large barn.

2022-11-27.name: Holidazzle
2022-11-27.summary: This free holiday market in Loring Park, on the edge of downtown, features an artisan market, appearances by Santa and the illuminated Holidazzle Yeti, outdoor yoga, choirs, a beer garden and fireworks.

2022-11-28.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2022-11-28.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-11-28.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-11-28.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-11-28.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2022-11-28.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-11-28.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-11-28.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2022-11-28.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2022-11-28.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2022-11-28.name: ZooLights
2022-11-28.summary: Admission to the annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays. Reserve time slots in advance.

2022-11-28.name: Rotary Lights
2022-11-28.summary: In Riverside Park, see a holiday display of 3 million lights with music. It opens with a parade, and Santa and reindeer are there every night through Dec. 23, with a live Nativity some nights. There are also carriage and helicopter rides, an ice rink with free use of skates, and free s'mores at fire pits.

2022-11-29.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights

There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-11-29.name: Holiday Kerstmarkt
2022-11-29.summary: This open-air European Christmas Market at the Eighth Street Market  Place includes 18 timber booths offering Dutch imports, folk art,  hand-knit apparel and other gifts.

2022-11-03.name: Driftless Film Festival
2022-11-03.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.
